alert.note: Alert for Lake; Volusia (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued November 05 at 7:43AM EST until November 09 at 1:00AM EST by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Florida... St Johns River Near Astor affecting Lake and Volusia Counties. .Natural flow on the Saint Johns River near Astor remains hindered due to northerly winds and tides. The river is forecast to level at Moderate Flood Stage 3.0 feet today. Slow improvements in level is forecast, with the river expected to fall back through Minor Flood Stage early this week. For the St. Johns River...including Astor...Moderate flooding is forecast. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 900 PM EST. && ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY THURSDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor to moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...St Johns River near Astor. * WHEN...Until early Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...At 3.0 feet, Moderate Flood | Water approaches or may enter lowest homes on or near Wildhog Road and nearby canals. Flooding reaches the parking lot of the Juno Trail Apartments. Flooding on portions of Alligator Road and Holiday Road. Lowest lying yards along Blue Creek are flooded. Roads at Astor Landing Campground and Lake Dexter Boat Ramp begin to flood. Water enters lower homes closest to the river on McPherson Lane. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:30 AM EST Sunday the stage was 2.9 feet. - Bankfull stage is 2.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 6:30 AM EST Sunday was 3.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 3.0 feet this afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage Wednesday evening. - Flood stage is 2.3 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (7 am) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Mon Tue Wed Thu Fri St Johns River Astor 2.3 2.9 Sun 6 am 2.9 2.7 2.4 2.2 2.2 &&
